feedInfo.title: BMW
feedInfo.body: Forget what you think you know about BMW being the "Ultimate Driving Machine" brand—those days are fading fast. The automaker has lost its way in recent years, prioritizing luxury and in-car technology versus satisfying driving characteristics and cars that communicate road feel and handling nuance to their drivers. Sure, if you look hard enough, you can find BMWs that live up to the hype—we're looking at you, 2-series and M2—but something clearly is amiss when the brand's X3 and X5 SUVs drive better than some of its cars. However, the latest 3-series has earned its way back into our good graces and currently sits atop its segment.

years.description: The 2023 BMW iX is the brand's first all-electric SUV, and it's mighty compelling with up to 290 miles of driving range with as much as 610 horsepower.
All-new and larger in every dimension than the SUV it replaces, the 2023 BMW X1 wears the brand's new design language well, including a bolder twin-kidney grille.
While it shares its entry-level positioning with the boxy X1 SUV, the 2023 BMW X2 distinguishes itself with a fastback roofline and spunky handling.
The 2023 BMW X3 SUV channels sports sedans from BMW's past while delivering contemporary levels of luxury and practicality.
With seriously quick acceleration and a sports-car-like experience, the 2023 BMW X3 M promises to please the adrenaline-seeking enthusiast.
Its sloped roof looks slick and wins it more attention, but ultimately the 2023 BMW X4 is a compromised package that's not as practical as the squared-off X3.
The 2023 BMW X4 M SUV is the point in the lineup at which style and performance converge, thanks to its fastback roofline and up to 503 romping, stomping horsepower.
The luxury SUV class is rich with choice, but the 2024 BMW X5 stands out with a blend of performance and refinement that many rivals lack.
The 2024 X5 M Competition is an ultra-high-performance SUV that uses the same twin-turbo V-8 as BMW’s most powerful sedan, the M5.
Using the same powertrains as the refreshed X5, the 2024 BMW X6 is a sharper-styled take on the luxurious mid-size luxury SUV.
BMW has enhanced the white-hot X6 M SUV for the 2024 model year with a new hybrid system, making the Competition pack standard, and giving it a visual refresh.
The 2023 BMW X7 is the brand's biggest SUV, and it has all the hallmarks of a posh people mover in addition to satisfying driving manners.
BMW's M performance division, purveyor of land rockets like the M3 and M5, has dropped a hot-rod SUV called the XM on the tall-speedster class.
The 2023 BMW 2-series coupe’s zesty powertrain rewards spirited driving enough to nearly make us forgive its lack of a manual transmission.
With a low starting price, the 2023 2-series Gran Coupe plants its flag on the affordable end of the BMW lineup but it lacks the harmonious feel of its stablemates.
No matter which one of its silky powertrains is on duty, the 2023 BMW 3-series is satisfying to drive and remarkably refined.
The BMW 4-series coupe and convertible offer potent powertrains, rear- or all-wheel drive options, and a luxurious cabin in stylish two-door packaging.
The considerably capable BMW 4-series Gran Coupe is well equipped and offers the aesthetic allure of a sporty two-door with the practicality of a sedan.
A new BMW 5-series is on its way for 2024 and we're hoping it provides a more fun-to-drive nature than the outgoing one, which was too soft for our taste.
BMW's big luxury sedan is all-new for 2023 and features some impressive new tech features, a plush ride, a spacious interior, and appropriately deluxe cabin ambiance.
With a decadent cabin and terrific powertrains, the BMW 8-series coupe and convertible offer next-level luxury, but they're not as exciting to look at or drive.
When is a coupe not a coupe? When it's a 2023 BMW 8-series Gran Coupe which, despite its sloped roofline and sporty stance, is actually a four-door sedan.
Based on the gasoline 3-series, the all-electric 2023 BMW i4 sedan lineup includes both a 300-mile range luxe model and a high-performance M50 with 536 horsepower.
BMW’s next battery-electric sedan, dubbed the i5, will debut for the 2024 model year with as much as 590 horsepower powering the range-topping M60 trim.
Packed to the gills with both tech and luxury features, the 2024 BMW i7 is an electric flagship sedan for the chronically online.
BMW's hybrid halo car is expected to get a second chance as the company prepares a hotter replacement in the form of the 2026 i8 M.
The 2023 BMW M2 launches an all-new generation of the two-door, rear-drive M-rocket with a 453-hp twin-turbo inline-six, and a standard manual transmission.
The 2024 BMW M3 lineup is even crazier this year, with a new, lighter, 543-hp CS model that will improve its already mind-blowing performance.
The BMW M4 coupe blends the look and luxury of the standard 4-series with the potent performance chops of the thrilling M3 four-door super sedan.
The next-generation M5 evolves into a plug-in-hybrid asphalt eater with a rumored 735 horsepower with the possibility of offering a Touring station wagon model.
The 617-hp twin-turbo V-8 found in the M8 coupe and convertible moves these two-door German rockets with magnum force, and they handle the power with poise and panache.
The BMW M8 Gran Coupe is a swoopy four-door with 617 horsepower and performance numbers that'll embarrass countless sports cars.
Confident handling is expected from a BMW sports car, and the 2023 Z4 delivers that, but its upscale cabin is comfortable enough to also serve as a daily driver.
Based on the gasoline 3-series, the all-electric 2023 BMW i4 sedan lineup includes both a 300-mile range luxe model and a high-performance M50 with 536 horsepower.
Packed to the gills with both tech and luxury features, the 2024 BMW i7 is an electric flagship sedan for the chronically online.
The 2023 BMW iX is the brand's first all-electric SUV, and it's mighty compelling with up to 290 miles of driving range with as much as 610 horsepower.
The basic 128i is quick and relatively affordable.
BMW's only wagon for the states comes in the form of the competent, practical, and stylish 3-series Sports Wagon.
The 6-series is BMW’s largest convertible offering, embodying the spirit of elegant, open-top grand touring in a most modern fashion.
With its sweeping roofline and muscular stance, the Gran Coupe disguises a pair of rear doors while retaining the sporty façade of the two-door on which it is based.
If you’re in the market for a luxury car but want something distinctive, BMW has you covered with the 6-series Gran Turismo.
The 2021 BMW i3 is designed to stand out, even among other electric vehicles, but its stingy driving range doesn't come close to matching that of rival EVs.
The 2020 BMW i8 boasts outside-the-box styling and a plug-in powertrain that saves fuel, but it lacks the performance of more exotic sports cars.
Blending a tasteful yet aggressive design with extraordinary performance, the BMW M6 is a sexy beast indeed.
We think the “M” in M6 stands for more; here, BMW’s four-door “coupe” comes in a performance version with a sport-tuned chassis and a 560-hp twin-turbo.
